title: Does Ekko's R really need that heal?
body:
Isn't ekko's ultimate basically the thing people don't like about Zed.

Why on earth does he need a colossal heal to go with that?
Surely his ultimate getting him out of trouble is enough. Rubbish ekko's just ult, no matter where the clone is and win the fight anyway because they're on full health.

At least if Zed dives you, you can get some DOT or ignite on him and he might die from that. With Ekko, nope, he just healed all of it back.

replies.body: Yes he needs the heal because going back in time will heal you back to where you were back in time. What he doesn't need is the huge damage that comes with it

I'll agree with this. Dota 2 has a character named Weaver that can step back in time 4 seconds just like Ekko can. The difference? Weaver can't nuke an entire team for over 1000 damage by doing so. It doesn't do any damage at all, in fact.

> [{quoted}](name=BigDumbSmartGuy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=mzVJqAge,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2015-05-29T14:58:26.210+0000)
>
> I'll agree with this. Dota 2 has a character named Weaver that can step back in time 4 seconds just like Ekko can. The difference? Weaver can't nuke an entire team for over 1000 damage by doing so. It doesn't do any damage at all, in fact.

But Weaver will heal to full health and mana.

Ekko's ult only heals for a portion of the damage he took during the last 4 seconds before he casts his ultimate.

Which, if an entire team focuses him, he can heal for more than 3000 damage in less than a second, PLUS all of your team's ults are now down. (This actually happened in a game I had. Lissandra ulted him, I ulted him (as braum) zac ulted him, our ez was attacking, and we got like 2 ignites on him.... then he pressed R and healed literally everything back, while all of our ults were on cooldown.)

He won't take enough damage without dying that his heal will give him 3000 health back, probably even if he builds full tank for some reason. Your problem most likely lies in the fact that you're expecting two tank's CC based ultimates to be dealing massive damage.

And don't misuse the word literally. He only heals for 30% of the damage taken plus 200 or so at max level.

ignite, morello halve it and its only heal if you take a lots of damage in the last 4 sec.
I don't understand his ult at all I just know 3 people on my team randomly died when he ulted.
You can tell exactly where he will ult to. Look for the blue shadow dude (that shows where he was 4 seconds ago). Avoid that spot (or go there if you want to catch him after he ults).
In the midst of a big battle that we should have won, none of us could tell where the hell that thing even was.

Positioning is part of the game. If you can't position or pay attention to others' positioning in a teamfight, it will be a costly mistake. Positioning determines teamfights just as much as pressing a button or autoattacking.

I hate to say this, but that was on your team. But he's new, so you're not used to it quite yet, so don't take it too hard. Next time, pay attention and respect the ghost.

When you are in a clusterfuck of abilities crowding the screen no one sees what is going on, and given how Ekko is yet another mobile pussy of a champion, You can only pay attention to so much, and his ults fog or whatever does not stand out.

I will fully blame the fact he is new on how we all died, I won't however accept he should be capable of doing that.

It definitely needs some toning down, I'll admit. At the very least, it'll put him in your team if he ults to all of you, which *is* risky. He isn't Zed who gets an escape after his burst, Ekko gets the burst or the escape (well, if someone is caught out and he kills them, I guess that counts, but it's not completely foolproof). 

And the ghost could use a tad more clarity, maybe. Definitely his W too.

Not saying that Ekko doesn't need nerfs (which he does, that nuke on his ult definitely needs to be scaled back, it should remain though because landing it is actually very difficult....and I will explain why in just a second).

Now then, lets examine a champion that has an interesting part of her kit:

{{champion:61}}  and namely, her ball.

Now then, everyone knows the key to playing {{champion:61}}  is properly keeping track of where the ball is and positioning it correctly.

What some people aren't very aware of is that this is also the key to defeating {{champion:61}} .  However doing so during a hectic teamfight is quite difficult to properly do (even for the {{champion:61}}, although it is somewhat easier for her because her kit relies on it)


Now then, how does that connect with Ekko you ask?

Well....oddly enough the ball from {{champion:61}}  and Ekko's past self clone thingy actually have a fairly similar function in terms of how they work.  In order for Ekko to use his clone thing properly he must know exactly where he was 4 seconds ago (and to compound that he has to accurately predict where his enemy shall be in 4 seconds, the difficulty of which varies on a case by case basis).  Keeping track of the clone is difficult in combat, and is actually quite difficult to properly use in a true teamfight for Ekko because he has to predict his clones positioning relative to his enemies.  Now it is easier for him because he has practiced but that doesn't change the fact that if his enemy also pays attention to where his clone is, then his clones power is drastically reduced (in a way that is very similar to {{champion:61}} and her ball in that respect).

I know how he works but he needs massive clarity issues resolved, the fact he can hop around makes it even more difficult to really focus on things in a fight without randomly everyone being blown up.

Agreed. I understand why they did it. They wanted him to have decision making with the ult and not have it ALWAYS be a safety net for whatever he does wrong.

But they overestimated how hard the ult would be to land, and gave it too much damage to compensate for it.
But in the trailer it showed him not being healed, he still seemed damaged.

i dont put much faith in the champion sneak peaks, but at least in the sneak peak he still suffered the damage he took

Edit - i can understand the damage though. in his fight with the brawly Zaun, he was able to use what he learned to give him an advantage in a fight - which can show in game as more damage.
